ai-thag13.1:1.1_0: He who was special in the kingdom,
ai-thag13.1:1.2_0: the footman to the king of Aṅga,
ai-thag13.1:1.3_0: today is special in the Dhamma—
ai-thag13.1:2.1_0: Five to cut, five to drop,
ai-thag13.1:2.3_0: A monk who has got over five kinds of clinging
ai-thag13.1:2.4_0: before you call them a flood-crosser.
ai-thag13.1:3.1_0: If a monk is insolent and negligent,
ai-thag13.1:4.1_0: They disregard what should be done,
ai-thag13.1:4.2_0: They do what has not been done.
ai-thag13.1:4.3_0: For the insolent and the negligent,
ai-thag13.1:5.3_0: don’t cultivate what should not be done,
ai-thag13.1:5.4_0: but always do what should be done.
ai-thag13.1:5.6_0: their defilements come to an end.
ai-thag13.1:6.1_0: The straight path has been explained—
ai-thag13.1:6.2_0: go on it and don’t turn back.
ai-thag13.1:7.2_0: the supreme Teacher in the world
ai-thag13.1:7.3_0: created the simile of the lute for me.
ai-thag13.1:9.2_0: And to seclusion of the mind,
ai-thag13.1:9.4_0: And to the end of grasping,
ai-thag13.1:10.1_0: when you’re dedicated to the ending of craving
ai-thag13.1:10.3_0: and you’ve seen the arising of the senses,
ai-thag13.1:11.1_0: To that poised one, rightly freed
ai-thag13.1:13.1_0: And mental objects, good and bad,
ai-thag13.1:13.3_0: Their mind is steady and unfettered
ai-thag13.1:13.7_0: The Book of the Thirteens is finished.
ai-thag13.1:14.0_0: Then they pass away from that host of gods
ai-thag13.1:14.2_0: One of great power and great majesty.
ai-thag13.1:14.4_0: And in this verse the meaning shown by you:
